title.narrative: Public Investment in Health Primary Serv

description.narrative: NGO Forum on Cambodia (NGOF) is a national membership organization working on a broader range of policies issues including aid effectiveness, economic development, and national budget. NGOF is a secretariat of Budget Working Group (BWG), the only coalition in Cambodia working to advocate for transparency and accountability of national budget. NGOF has been in partnership with Oxfam in Cambodia under the Finance for Development since 2016. The prime concern of NGOF in phase I was on the national budget National budget which is the core of the development to meet the need of its people especially those who are poor and marginalized group such as elderly, children, disable people and women. It also contributes to poverty reduction that requires the efficient use of public resources, which could be improved through better budget allocation, execution, and accountability. The approaches used are networking and alliance building for collective voice of CSOs and publics to hold the government responsible for policies enforcement and fiscal management. Capacity building, research, direct engagement and promote participation were the intervention used in phase I. In phase II, NGOF will focus on the budget allocation on health sector, with the objective of Increasing 5% of government spending because the sector needs more attention in term of budget allocation. The public health care system has a high priority of the government for the improvements in the health profile. Health sector reform has been guided by a long-term process of national health planning and budgeting with the Ministry of Health (MoH). By August 15, 2018, Prime Minister Hun Sen said #people#s health is nation#s health, that is why government has to pay attention to this issue and strengthen the health sector, health services to be stronger.# Prime Minister Hu Sen announced to increase the budget for health in the next year#s national budget to improve the welfare of people. He urges for social protection to higher and pay attention. However,the total budget allocated to MoH in 2019 decreased by 7.4% of the total state budget, if compared to national budget law 2018. Concerning working approach, at the national level, NGOF will working closely with a wide range of key actors to influence on Government health policies for the benefit of pro-poor and marginalized group suchas women, elderly, youth and disable people. The Ministry of Health (MoH) and Ministry of Economy and Finance (MEF) is the key actors and development partners included UNICEF, GIZ and the international NGOs such as Save the Children and Oxfam will support in bringing the issues to dialogue and directly engagement with MoE and MEF. The Health Action Coordinating Committee (HACC), other BWG members, sub-national civil society organizations, Media and the youth groups will the participating stakeholders and co-organizers to ensure that poor and marginalized group are involved in the project

participating-org.narrative:
The NGO Forum was started in Cambodia in the 1980s by international NGOs who wanted to put an end to Cambodia's international isolation and aid embargo. In the 1990s, as Cambodia opened up to the world, the NGO Forum became Cambodia-based, and began to invite local organisations to join as members. Nevertheless, it was still governed by an international Steering Committee and dominated by international NGOs right up to 1996. In 1997 a clear decision was made to make the NGO Forum more relevant to the concerns of the Cambodian people, resulting in an expansion of the membership base among local NGOs. A new expatriate representative was recruited and given the mandate to transition the NGO Forum towards full Cambodian leadership. Cambodian staff members began to play dominant roles in NGO Forum activities, and the first fully Cambodian Management Committee was elected in 2000. Over the course of the next eight years, the NGO Forum grew to respond to a number of emerging critical issues affecting poor and vulnerable communities across Cambodia.
The NGO Forum on Cambodia is a membership organisation for local and international NGOs based in Cambodia. It exists for the purpose of information sharing, debate and advocacy on priority issues affecting Cambodia's development. It aims to represent the viewsof the NGO community to decision-makers on issues such as development policy (overall economic and political issues), gender mainstreaming, and environmental protection and land rights. Presently the NGO Forum on Cambodia registers 79 full members and two associate members. Of the 79 full members, 46 are local NGOs and 33 are international NGOs.
